meanings.definition: To press out or squeeze out forcefully.
meanings.sent1: She was outpressing the juice from the orange.
meanings.sent2: The athlete was outpressing the last bit of energy from his muscles.
meanings.sent3: The chef was outpressing the flavors from the herbs for the sauce.
meanings.sent4: The machine outpresses the oil from the olives with great efficiency.
meanings.sent5: The wringer outpresses the water from the clothes, leaving them almost dry.

meanings.definition: The act of pressing out or squeezing out forcefully.
meanings.sent1: The outpressing of the toothpaste tube was messy.
meanings.sent2: The outpressing of the grapes produced a delicious juice.
meanings.sent3: The outpressing of the sponge made a funny squeaky sound.
meanings.sent4: The outpressing of emotions can sometimes lead to misunderstandings.
meanings.sent5: The outpressing of the air from the balloon made it shrink quickly.
